name: SupportMoulderVanessaB
_source: s;Moulder;Well, do you have time for that story I promised?
s;Moulder;It was over ten years ago, when the prince was just a child.|There was a ceremony at the castle, with a trick archer of sorts.

s;Moulder;Yes. He was a very famous and undeniably skilled archer from abroad.|He was to shoot a tiny target that had been placed in the distance.|However, in the middle of the show, someone stopped him from shooting.
s;Moulder;Yes, it was young Prince Innes.|He said, "That's not far enough! Move the target back farther!"|Then, he insisted on trying himself.
s;Moulder;Isn't it?{br}King Hayden tried to stop him, but...|Well, you know how he is. He doesn't listen to anyone.|And so, it became a contest between our prince and this foreign archer.

s;Moulder;First, they established the ground rules.|Each person was to shoot at the target. If both arrows hit, they increased the range.|They simply continued to move the target back until one person missed the mark.

s;Moulder;Ah, but the two were evenly matched. Every shot was a perfect bull's-eye.|The crowd cheered, and the target moved ever farther back...|But then it came to the turning point. The foreign archer said,|"This is no test. Let's move the target back more."|It seemed like bravado, but the archer actually had a clever tactic in mind.

s;Moulder;They had been shooting for some time, and the archer's arms had grown weary.|Precision archery is far more taxing than the battlefield, you see.|So even though he was a skilled archer, he was at the limits of his endurance.|He was still hitting the mark accurately, but his arm was quivering more and more.|Everyone knew that the prince was on the verge of victory.
s;Vanessa;I don't understand. They were shooting at the same target, shot for shot, right?|Why would moving the target make any difference?

s;Moulder;Yes, they were still shooting at the same target.|However, the archer suggested that they move the target much farther away...|Much farther than any child Innes's age could hope to loose an arrow to.
s;Moulder;Even the archer, with his trained arms, was firing at his maximum range.|In fact, he almost missed the target!|Then, it was the prince's turn.

s;Moulder;It was clearly too far away for the young prince to hit the target.|But His Highness was undeterred. He drew his string and fired up into the sky.|The arrow did not merely hit the target. No, it was a perfect bull's-eye!|You see, the prince arced his shot to extend his range beyond its limits.|To hit a target this way requires incredible skill, but the prince did it.|And then he turned to the archer and said, |Shall we move the target back farther?"|The archer looked so crestfallen. He admitted defeat, and it was settled.
s;Vanessa;Thank you very much, Father Moulder! That's incredible! I'm even more--
s;Moulder;I'm glad you liked the story.|Keep up the good work, Vanessa.
